yes I'm getting emails from you and I'm investigating.  It looks like those of you that didn't receive an email from me were marked as late applications and therefore were not emailed as part of the ontime application process
we get penalized for keeping them up to date with metric data

Www.streamerapp.com
@tomswiftjr got replied from Kirsty (about late applications, not resubmitted)

Our whole approach to reading late applications is different. Applications that arrive by the deadline are read by multiple people. Late applications are skimmed by one person in case anything sticks out. If we interview a group that applies late, we don't (usually) do it during the usual interview weekend. We arrange something ad hoc.
So, if you are marked as a late application then we won't have emailed you yesterday
@tilt I don't mean to sound snarky, but how do you know? are you part of YC?
@tilt when will they be making decisions on late apps?
whatever this situation is with the late apps - I respect it because YC is not allowing themselves to be rushed and valuing the updates.
@tilt thanks
@Kirsty and that means they weren't read?

@Kirsty -- so YC is considering people who initially submitted pre-deadline but then resubmitted after deadline late?
@Kirsty my bad
@Kirsty that doesn't seem clear to me on http://www.ycombinator.com/late.html

@Kirsty I stand by my 2nd point, though...if you just modify after the deadline, it doesn't seem fair that you're now in the "afterthought" pile, when 99% of your app could have been submitted a month early.
